data.title: Police in Turkey now allowed to detain "potential protesters" without a court order, based merely on their looks, in what an opposition member calls "beyond fascism"
Muslims formed a human chain outside a Pakistan church during mass to act as a shield for those attending Sunday mass inside.
"China is employing two million people to keep tabs on people's Internet use, according to state media, in a rare glimpse into the secret world of Beijing's vast online surveillance operation."

Russia to monitor 'all communications' at Winter Olympics in Sochi "Athletes and spectators attending the Winter Olympics in Sochi in February will face some of the most invasive and systematic spying and surveillance in the history of the Games, documents shared with the Guardian show."
Two Canadians who have been detained in an Egyptian jail for over a month without charges have been released, the Canadian government has confirmed.
